title: Wallapop
content: ¿Por qué no permite mozilla operar con Wallapop? No se puede iniciar sesión, ni ver mensajes y acceder a los chats desde la última actulización
creator: javitoro51

title: Wallapop
content: Desde la última actulización hace unos dias en windows 7 y noté este fallo, al principio creí que era cosa de la propia web de wallapop pero depués de cuatro días después el error persiste. Sucede cuando navegando por la web se elige cualquier artículo y se quiere iniciar una conversación con el vendedor, cuando se hace click sobre el icono chat (arriba a la derecha) la web va al apartado de conversaciones almacenadas pero no da opción alguna de inciar una nueva conversación, sólo puedes continuar con las existentes. He desinstalado todos los complementos que tenía para un inicio en limpio pero el error sigue ahí. Lógicamente he probado con otros navegadores y la web funciona sin problemas, se puede iniciar una conversación con cualquier usuario de wallapop, pero desde la nueva versión de firefox no se puede. Con Chrome y Opera no hay ningún problrema...
creator: javitoro51

title: Firefox always uses US settings instead of UK
content: I have set Firefox Developer Edition (Windows 10 20H2 & 21H2 and Ubuntu 18.04 & 20.04 installations, always kept up to date), to use English (United Kingdom) settings in preferences. I have installed the UK Dictionary and made it the default for spellchecking. The Windows installation is also supposed to be respecting the OS regional settings. Firefox seems to be totally disregarding the settings and always giving me US as the location and US English for the spellcheck. This has been an issue for months if not years. I understand that many pages will be US biased, that is not a problem. The problems are that my country preference is being detected as US, and that I can not seem to get Firefox to actually use the UK Dictionary. I can supply additional information as required
creator: UrBob

creator: miriam6

title: Startup Page
content:
Is there no plan at all to bring back the option to Startup Firefox with pre-defined URLs or at least the Home Page? There is that option on old versions of Firefox, not sure why you decided to not have it on the latest versions.

At the moment, these are the only options available

Open previous windows and tabs Always check if Firefox is your default browser

Obviously, the workaround is close all windows and tabs and re-start but that should not have been the case if there is that option to set what URL to start
creator: newbie_01

Thanks you, Pasan Madusanka.
creator: bmapmadusanka

title: 500 MB of RAM per tab??
content:
Hi everyone,

I have the problem in the Subject line. FF sucks about 500 MB to be run, on top of which it takes 500 MB per tab, and that makes it impossible to run a research on my 8 GB Mac. Yesterday I was looking for a lamp and had no more than 7 tabs open, 3 of which were largely text, 2 were online shops, and 1-2 were websites with pictures. No Facebook or social media, no YouTube. FF froze, made the whole Mac freeze (well, Mac is garbage nowadays but let's leave that out of this topic), and I had to wait MINUTES before I could close it, because the computer was nonreactive.

When I check online, I see people being like "why can't it manage more than 50 tabs?". 50?!?! My computer dies with a maximum of 10 when it's only text websites!

So, I guess there's something wrong with this.

- I don't have many extensions (SimilarWeb, VPN, and Flash Player), I always use incognito so I can't use the plugin that allows me to use several accounts at the same time, so I can't see what's messing with my Mac. - The Activity Monitor (pretty much Task Manager on Windows) shows "FirefoxCP Isolated Web Content" for each tab, could that have anything to do with my problem? - CPU usage is very low, some 0.5 to 10% max during heavy use. - I seem to remember I used to have dozens of tabs open in the past, although I can't be sure. Is this a recent problem?

I really hope there's a way to solve this, because now I always fear that opening FF while on a Zoom meeting might freeze the whole thing.

Thanks to anyone who might want to shed some light on this big problem.

Screenshots: RAM and CPU usage with 2 tabs open. Two, taking more than 1 GB of RAM and about 250 threads in total? While using 0.2% of the CPU? I'm lost
creator: muvuth

title: Sync fill in blank not working
content:
[Locked as a duplicate of https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1361991. Please follow up there, thanks.]

When you have a blank box asking for an Email address, or Name, or address, password, etc...When you click on it...it used to fill in automatically...Now it does "Nothing" (NO ERROR Message) You have to fill it in yourself. Funny thing is it still works OK with Chrome and I really do not want to go back to using that! When you go into Settings and select sync and everything is checked and Saved....It still does nothing. Firefox 95.0.2 64bit Windows 10 pro. This just stopped working recently and the only thing I can think was added was Norton 360 but I have used Norton antivirus in the past and never had an issue, plus any windows updates. Really irritating!
creator: davespc01
